meanings.definition: One who legitimizes or makes legitimate.
meanings.sent1: The legitimizer of the group ensured that all decisions were fair and just.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer acted as a legitimizer for the contract, making sure it was legally binding.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake was the legitimizer of the party, bringing everyone together for a joyful celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the legitimizer of her kindness, making everyone feel welcome and appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The key witness was the legitimizer of the case, providing crucial evidence to support the verdict.

meanings.sent1: She tried to legitimize her parking by paying the fee before leaving.
meanings.sent2: The official document was legitimized by the signature of the authorized person.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to legitimize his excuse for being late by blaming traffic.
meanings.sent4: The new law aimed to legitimize the use of renewable energy sources.
meanings.sent5: The certificate legitimized her qualifications for the job, securing her position in the company.
